tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ForestMonitoring ( 
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
    location VARCHAR(100), 
    deforestation_rate FLOAT, 
    monitoring_date DATE 
)

CREATE TABLE forest_areas (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(255),
    latitude DECIMAL,
    longitude DECIMAL,
    deforestation_rate DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE deforestation_data (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_id INT,
    date DATE,
    deforestation_amount DECIMAL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_area FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES forest_areas(id)
);

CREATE TABLE DeforestationData (
  data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  region_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  deforestation_rate DECIMAL(5, 2) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (region_id) REFERENCES ForestRegions(region_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ReforestationEfforts (
  effort_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  region_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  trees_planted INT NOT NULL,
  success_rate DECIMAL(5, 2) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (region_id) REFERENCES ForestRegions(region_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Forests (
    forest_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forest_name VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    deforestation_rate FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE DeforestationData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forest_id INT,
    date DATE,
    deforestation_area FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE ReforestationEfforts (
    effort_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forest_id INT,
    date DATE,
    reforestation_area FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE ReforestationTrends (
    trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forest_id INT,
    trend_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE WeatherConditions (
	condition_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	year INT NOT NULL,
	season VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
	average_temperature FLOAT NOT NULL,
	rainfall_amount FLOAT NOT NULL
);
